intro: Heliocarpus excelsior, commonly known as the golden apple tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The fruit is a hard, woody capsule that turns orange when mature, containing several seeds. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. It plays an important ecological role by providing food for various wildlife species.
